site_name: BROADWATER GREEN, PETTMAN CRESCENT, LONDON, SE28 0DE
description: Demolition, refurbishment and extension of existing playground, introduction of new play space including the erection of play apparatus, fence and gates and formation of new play trail

open_spaces_details.description: A informal play trail made from bark mulch will form a new connection between 'The Bind' play area in the north, and 'The Fray' and 'The Splice' to the south. This will wind through the existing semi-natural broadleaved woodland and will feature timber stepping stones and stepping boards. Bespoke marker posts will signpost the two entrances to the trail and will provide additional interest along it. The construction of the play trail will necessitate the selective removal of the scrub layer within the woodland. Scrub regeneration is expected to occur naturally within the woodland however, so this will not have a significant impact on the the condition of the retained woodland or on the opportunities presented to nesting birds. In addition, it is considered that the proposed tree, hedgerow and shrub planting will mitigate for the any habitat being lost and will enhance the site's ecological value.

'The Bind' play area in the north will provide a dedicated space for children and their parents/carers to gather and meet. Picnic tables and seating will be included, alongside teepee and willow nest gathering spaces. Musical play pieces will also feature, including a xylophone and spiral scraper. At present this area of the site consists solely of amenity grassland and semi-natural broadleaved woodland. All the amenity grassland and the vast majority of the semi-natural broadleaved woodland will be retained. Only a very small portion of the scrub layer of the woodland will be removed to make way for the teepee and willow nest gathering spaces. Scrub regeneration is expected to occur naturally within the woodland however, so this will not have a significant impact on the the condition of the retained woodland or on the opportunities presented to nesting birds. In addition, it is considered that the proposed tree, hedgerow and shrub planting will mitigate for the any habitat being lost and will enhance the site's ecological value.

The main play space ('The Fray') will encroach on the existing amenity grassland to the south-west and west of the existing play space and will necessitate the removal of a number of timber play stumps to the western boundary. This extension will include areas of wildflower planting, a play mound (height c. 1.2m) consisting of wildflower and amenity turf, two small play bark mulch footpaths, an area of amenity lawn and rubber tile safety surfacing to support the large climbing frame and slide, and bespoke hand-crafted seating.
